observations.topic: DKIM vendor mix signals SaaS-native user base
observations.observation: The DKIM vendor list now includes Stripe, Paddle, and Gumroad alongside five AI-platform vendors — three payment infrastructure providers that predominantly serve digital/SaaS merchants — suggesting a meaningful share of the 'Unknown' category's high-value receipts ($118.81 avg vs $51.35 for grocery) may be software subscriptions and digital purchases rather than uncategorized physical retail.

observations.topic: GMV per receipt divergence by window
observations.observation: The 7-day average receipt value is $57.45 ($34,988/609) while the 14-day average is $56.86 ($79,725/1,402) — nearly identical, suggesting the spend-per-receipt distribution has stabilized in the near term, but the cumulative all-time average of $58.20 ($197,834/3,399) is only marginally higher, implying early receipts were not dramatically larger and the platform has maintained consistent basket sizes throughout its growth.

The platform crossed three receipt milestones (1K, 2K, and 3K) in what appears to be a compressed window — reaching 3,399 total receipts with 1,402 in just the last 14 days (41% of all-time volume), suggesting receipt velocity is compounding rather than linear and the platform may hit 5K total receipts within weeks if the current 7-day rate of 609 receipts holds.

The 7-day window added 3 receipts but gained $30.28 in GMV, implying an average of ~$10.09 per new receipt — well below the 7-day window average of $57.69 — suggesting the three new transactions were small-basket purchases, possibly gas or convenience, pulling the per-receipt average slightly downward.

CBSA 38940 (Pensacola-Ferry Pass-Brent, FL) appears for the first time in the dataset, marking geographic expansion beyond the previously observed Colorado-heavy concentration — this is the 21st metro area in the recent signals window and worth tracking to see if it represents a one-off receipt or the beginning of a regional cluster.

With 3,394 receipts submitted but only 144 Lightning payouts completed to 130 wallets, roughly 96% of receipts have not yet resulted in a Lightning claim — at 153 sats per receipt and BTC at $65,513, unclaimed value sits near 500M+ sats, suggesting either a significant redemption lag or that most submitters are not yet wallet-enabled.

In the 14-day window, King Soopers leads with 107 receipts versus Kroger's 84 — notable because King Soopers is a Kroger-owned regional banner concentrated in Colorado, suggesting the user base has a significant geographic concentration in the Denver/Front Range metro area (CBSA 19740).

The platform has processed $197,742 across 3,394 receipts, with the 14-day window alone representing $79,633 — roughly 40% of all-time GMV — meaning nearly half of total platform volume was generated in just the last two weeks, a strong signal of accelerating adoption rather than steady-state growth.

The single new receipt added to the 7-day window brought in $334.46 ($34,866.87 - $34,532.41), which is roughly 5.8x the current 7-day average of $57.92 per receipt — a notably high-value transaction that could be pulling the window average upward.

observations.topic: AI-native vendor clustering in DKIM signals
observations.observation: Five of the nine DKIM vendors detected are directly tied to OpenAI or AI-adjacent platforms (OpenAI, tm1.openai.com, email.openai.com, Anthropic, Suno), suggesting the user base skews heavily toward early adopters of AI tools — a demographic signal that could inform targeting and partnership strategies.
